str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To harden, make hard, make stubborn. From skleros; to indurate, i.e. render stubborn.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To disobey, rebel, be disloyal, refuse conformity. From apeithes; to disbelieve.
A multitude, crowd, great number, assemblage. From pletho; a fulness, i.e. A large number, throng, populace.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To speak evil of, curse, revile, abuse. From a compound of kakos and logos; to revile.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A way, road, journey, path. Apparently a primary word; a road; by implication, a progress; figuratively, a mode or means.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To rail off, separate, place apart. From apo and horizo; to set off by boundary, i.e. limit, exclude, appoint, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A learner, disciple, pupil. From manthano; a learner, i.e. Pupil.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and histemi; to remove, i.e. instigate to revolt; usually to desist, desert, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To converse, address, preach, lecture; I argue, reason. Middle voice from dia and lego; to say thoroughly, i.e. Discuss.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably feminine of a presumed derivative of the alternate of echo; properly, loitering or leisure, i.e. a 'school'.
A provincial form of the derivative of the base of kurios; a 'tyrant'; Tyrannus, an Ephesian.
